alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Burlington County through 745 PM EDT... At 707 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Medford, or 17 miles east of Camden, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medford, Tabernacle, Shamong, Presidential Lakes Estates, Wharton State Forest, Presidential Lakes, Leisuretowne and Medford Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
